pull.title: Make GetFetchFlags always request witness objects from witness peers
pull.body:
This fixes a bug where we might (in exceedingly rare circumstances)
accidentally ban a node for sending us the first (potentially few)
segwit blocks in non-segwit mode.

See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8393#discussion_r81563418 for the compact-block-related issue, though there is a similar(ly rare) version in ::INV processing as well.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

events.message:
Make GetFetchFlags always request witness objects from witness peers

This fixes a bug where we might (in exceedingly rare circumstances)
accidentally ban a node for sending us the first (potentially few)
segwit blocks in non-segwit mode.
Fix overly-prescriptive p2p-segwit test for new fetch logic

events.body: might be worth dropping the pprev parameter completely?

This late in 13.1, I wanted to touch as little code as possible. I'd call that a candidate for cleanup in 14.

On October 7, 2016 5:45:50 PM GMT+02:00, Nicolas Dorier notifications@github.com wrote:

I guess this will be backported through #8393 .
